com.geoloqi.android.sdk
Class LQTracker

java.lang.Object
  com.geoloqi.android.sdk.LQTracker
All Implemented Interfaces:
android.location.LocationListener
public class LQTracker
extends java.lang.Object
implements android.location.LocationListener

LQTracker is a singleton responsible for queueing location updates and sending them to the server.

The tracker must run on a Looper thread such as the main thread of the application. This is due to the internal use of LocationManager.requestLocationUpdates(java.lang.String, long, float, android.location.LocationListener).

Maintainers are responsible for ensuring that any long running processes should occur on a background thread. The current implementation of LQTracker provides a private instance of a single thread ExecutorService for this purpose.

Copyright (c) 2011 Geoloqi Inc. All rights reserved.

Author:
Tristan Waddington

getBatchedLocationFixes

public android.database.Cursor getBatchedLocationFixes(android.database.sqlite.SQLiteDatabase db)

Query the database for a list of batched location fixes to be uploaded to the server.

Callers should take care to run this method on a background thread otherwise a large result may cause the main thread to be delayed.

Returns:
a Cursor containing all location fixes not marked as sent.

uploadLocationQueue

public void uploadLocationQueue()

Immediately flush all unsent fixes to the server.

If the request is successful, mark the fixes as sent and update the timestamp of the last location update.

This method is executed asynchronously on a background thread and will return immediately.

uploadLocationQueueIfNecessary

public void uploadLocationQueueIfNecessary()

Determine if we should upload our queued location data and if so execute uploadLocationQueue().

This method will call into uploadLocationQueue(), which is executed on a background thread. It is safe to call this method from the main thread.

requestLocationFix

public void requestLocationFix()

Request that the tracker determine the current location of the device. If a fix request is not already in progress, the tracker will temporarily switch to a higher accuracy mode.

This method is a no-op unless the tracker is running in the LQTracker.LQTrackerProfile.ADAPTIVE profile.

requestLocationFix

public void requestLocationFix(float accuracy,
                               long timeout)

Request that the tracker determine the current location of the device. If a fix request is not already in progress, the tracker will temporarily switch to a higher accuracy mode.

This method is a no-op unless the tracker is running in the LQTracker.LQTrackerProfile.ADAPTIVE profile.

Parameters:
accuracy - the desired accuracy in meters.
timeout - in milliseconds.

isFixRequestInProgress

public boolean isFixRequestInProgress()
Determine if a location fix request is in progress.

Returns:
true if a location fix request is in progress, false if otherwise.
